member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ApplyConfigurationStepResult.ErrorMessage
member.summary:
Error message that applies to the entire configuration step, not a particular item
When lists an error, it is not necessary to list that error here as well.
This error message should be used when the error spans multiple items, is not tied to a specific item, or it related to an item that does not have a title or description and is likely not visible on the UI.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ApplyConfigurationStepResult.NextConfigurationStep
member.summary: Contains the next that needs to be configured or null when there are no other steps to configure (or if there was an error)
Initializes required properties

member.name: T:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItem
member.summary: This class represents the data structure for a configuration item. A configuration item is used by a driver to indicate what information it needs from the consuming application in order to run. This may include settings for the transport (IP Address, port), authentication, instructions for pairing a device, license keys, or other specific settings for the driver to operate.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItem.Description
member.summary: Provides additional details about this item.
member.para: For example, a for a MAC Address, could have a title of "MAC Address" and a description of "Enter the MAC Address of the driver device using the following format XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX"

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItem.Id
member.summary: The unique Id of this configuration item. All must be unique for a given driver device. This Id must persist across reboots in order for the driver to associate the correct settings on a reboot.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItem.Required
member.summary:
Specifies where or not this item is required or optional. For example, Username and password may be optional while IP Address is required.
If the item does not have a value (like a message box) or is read-only, this flag has no meaning and can be ignored.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItem.Title
member.summary: A user visible heading for this item. The value should be concise and direct (eg. MAC Address, Registration Code).

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItem.UsageContext
member.summary: Provides information about the usage of the configuration item. The value must be set to a predefined value from the documentation or library, (usually in a static class named ConfigurationItemContext) For example, if the configuration item is for a RS-232 port, the of "Com.ChannelId" provides the consumer of this with contextual information about this item's intended usage. This information will also be used to determine whether or not a will be displayed or handled internally.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItem.UsageContextGroupId
member.summary: Optional group id that creates an association between various configuration items and their usage context. For example, a device with multiple relay ports would use this to associate the with the port that it is for.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItem.Value
member.summary: Optional field for a who's usage depends on the . This field typically provides a way for a user to input information to a driver device (like for a "Generic.Prompt" usage context) or it could also be used for the driver device to provide display a read-only value (such as default port settings) or a url to the user for "Generic.Url"

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItem.ValueType
member.summary: Indicates the data type of the . See for valid options.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItem.Availability
member.summary: Indicates when the configuration item should be available. See for valid options.

member.name: T:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemAvailability
member.summary: Options indicating when a would be available.

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemAvailability.FirstTimeConfiguration
member.summary: Indicates that this should only be shown when configuring the driver device for the first time. To persist the and receive it when the driver starts, use the flag.
member.para: This option is useful for cases where the driver has configuration settings and/or instructions that only apply when first configuring (or re-configuring) the device. For example, the driver may require a registration code which expires after a certain amount of time. The registration code is only used during initial pairing and is not used again. Another example would be a driver providing instructions for the initial pairing ("Press the menu button on the device for 5 seconds to enter pairing mode.")

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemAvailability.Always
member.summary: Indicates that this should be always be available. These items will remain available after the initial configuration is complete.

member.name: T:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemValue
member.summary: Information about the value of a .

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemValue.AvailableValues
member.summary: The list of valid values that can be applied to the . This field is optional and may be null.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemValue.CurrentValue
member.summary: Indicates what the value of the is currently set to. A value of null indicates that there has not been any value assigned. An empty string indicates that a value was assigned (which was the empty string). This can be useful in scenarios where an empty string is the desired value for a configuration item (Ex. Credentials with a username and a blank password)

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemValue.CurrentValueDisplayOverride
member.summary: A value that will be displayed instead of the . For of "Generic.Url", this value could be used to show a user friendly hyperlink name in lieu of the URL.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemValue.DefaultValue
member.summary: Indicates what the default value of the should be. A value of null indicates that there is no default value.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemValue.HasRange
member.summary: Indicates that the has a and a . When this field is set to true, both the and must be defined.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemValue.Masked
member.summary: Indicates that the and contain sensitive information and should not be displayed (Ex. A password field)

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemValue.MaxValue
member.summary: Indicates what the maximum value is for the . For numeric values ( , ) this is an upper bound on the value of the number. For string values this field represents the maximum number of characters allowed in the string.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemValue.MinValue
member.summary: Indicates what the minimum value is for the . For numeric values ( , ) this is a lower bound on the value of the number. For string values this field represents the minimum number of characters required in the string.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemValue.Persistent
member.summary: Indicates that the must be stored by the consuming application and sent to the driver on initialization.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemValue.ReadOnly
member.summary: Indicates that the can not be assigned a different value.

member.name: T:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemValueType
member.summary: Provides options indicating what type information is for the This value applies to the , , and

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemValueType.None
member.summary: Indicates that there is no value associated with the

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemValueType.String
member.summary: Indicates that the is a string. This also applies to the and

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemValueType.Number
member.summary: Indicates that the is a number. This also applies to the and The valid range is from 0 - 65535.

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemValueType.Boolean
member.summary: Indicates that the is a boolean. This also applies to the and

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DeviceConfiguration.ConfigurationItemValueType.Hex
member.summary: Indicates that the is a hexadecimal. This also applies to the and The valid range is from 0x0000 - 0xFFFF.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityCommandMetadata.AdministrationCommand
member.summary: True when this command should be exposed as a console command or through a similar interface for installers, developers, and testers.

member.name: T:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityDefinition
member.summary:
Defines the commands, properties, and types supported by the controller
Information is split into definition and metadata. The definitions provide the information needed to consume the item. The metadata provides additional information about the item that can provide hints to certain system features about how the item should be used but does not affect the operation of the item itself.
For a Crestron-defined command, event, property, or type, the definition is constant and a driver may not change it. However, a driver may specify its own metadata. This is why the collections are separate.
For example, a driver may implement the standard Crestron property for "is online" but also want to refer to that property in its extension UI. It would not be able to modify the definition of that property since it is a standard one. However, since the flag for extension properties is part of the metadata, the driver would be able to specify it.
Initialize with required properties
member.remarks: This will make a copy of the dictionaries before returning

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityDefinition.Commands
member.summary: Mapping of command names to definitions. Command names must be alphanumeric and start with a letter. Consumers should not assume that, though, since internally we may use reserved characters like $ to implement special commands.
member.remarks: This dictionary is immutable (we won't change it) and read-only (will throw if you try to change it)

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityDefinition.CommandMetadata
member.summary: Driver-specific metadata about commands in the collection. Not all commands will have metadata.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityDefinition.Events
member.summary: Mapping of event names to definitions. Event names must be alphanumeric and start with a letter. Consumers should not assume that, though, since internally we may use reserved characters like $ to implement special events.
member.remarks: This dictionary is immutable (we won't change it) and read-only (will throw if you try to change it)

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityDefinition.EventMetadata
member.summary: Driver-specific metadata about events in the collection. Not all events will have metadata.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityDefinition.Properties
member.summary: Mapping of top-level names to definitions. Property names must be alphanumeric and start with a letter. Consumers should not assume that, though, since internally we may use reserved characters like $ to implement special properties.
member.remarks: This dictionary is immutable (we won't change it) and read-only (will throw if you try to change it)

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityDefinition.PropertyMetadata
member.summary: Driver-specific metadata about properties in the collection. Not all properties will have metadata.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityDefinition.Types
member.summary: Lookup for type definitions referred to by s. Type names must be alphanumeric and start with a letter. Consumers should not assume that, though, since internally we may use reserved characters like $ to implement special types.
member.para: This is necessary to support the required metadata for the extension device UI.
member.remarks: This dictionary is immutable (we won't change it) and read-only (will throw if you try to change it)

member.summary: Helper to create an instance based on enumerable collections

member.name: T:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityParameterDefinition
member.summary: Describes the type information for a parameter in

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityParameterDefinition.AvailableValuesProperty
member.summary:
The name of a top-level property that defines the device-specific available values for this parameter.
That property's must be a and must be . and the value may change at runtime.
member.remarks: May be null

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityParameterDefinition.FriendlyName
member.summary: The friendly name for this parameter
member.remarks: Members inside this may be null

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityParameterDefinition.OptionalFeature
member.summary:
If true, the parameter is optional and devices are not required to include it.
This is more meaningful when reading definitions than at runtime since a driver which does not support the parameter would not include it at all. However, when a parameter is an optional feature, drivers should report consistent with the definition for the sake of consistency. When reading definitions in documentation and is true, applications should check the definitions of a driver's command to see if it includes the parameter or not.
The value of this property has no bearing on whether or not the application is required to send it. The property is what indicates whether or not the application is required to provide it when calling the command.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityParameterDefinition.OptionalParameter
member.summary:
If true, the parameter is optional for applications to provide when calling the command.
Drivers must handle the case where the parameter is not present as defined in the description of the command (or, according to their own design if it is a custom command). This may mean using a default value, or having some specific meaning when the parameter is not present (i.e. not taking an action for that parameter).
When documentation specifies that is true, and is false (or omitted), the driver is still required to implement the parameter and tolerate the application omitting it in calls. is the flag which determines whether or not the parameter itself may be omitted by a driver implementing the command.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityParameterDefinition.Default
member.summary:
The default value for this parameter
If is false, callers are still required to pass this parameter in even if they use the default value. If is true and is specified by the driver, calling with the argument not specified or with it specified as the default value should result in the same behavior.
member.remarks: Will be null if there is no default value for the parameter

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityParameterDefinition.RangeProperty
member.summary:
The name of a top-level property that defines the device-specific range for this parameter.
That property's must be a and the value may change at runtime.
member.remarks: May be null

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityParameterDefinition.RelativeRangeProperty
member.summary:
The name of a top-level property that defines the device-specific relative range for this parameter.
That property's must be a and the value may change at runtime.
member.remarks: May be null

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityParameterDefinition.TypeDef
member.summary:
Information about the type of this parameter

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityParameterDefinition.TypeRef
member.summary:
Name of the to reference from for

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityParameterDefinition.UnitsProperty
member.summary:
The name of a top-level property that defines the device-specific units for this parameter.

member.name: T:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityPropertyDefinition
member.summary:
Describes a device property's type metadata, constraints, and relationships to other properties.
Some properties, commands, etc. will be defined by Crestron and contain a ':' in the name. In these cases, the definition is static and will always be the same for a given version of that property's definition. This means that if
is defined, it describes the API of that property (i.e. 0 - 100 for a percentage) and is *NOT* to be used by devices to describe the actual physical property range on the device. If the range would vary per device, must be used, and the device may specify the value of that property to advertise its range. The same goes for other members.

member.name: M:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityPropertyDefinition.#ctor(Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityLocalizedString,System.String,Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityTypeDefinition,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)

member.summary:
The name of a neighboring or top-level property that defines the device-specific available values for this property.
That property's must be a and must be . and the value may change at runtime. If a neighboring property with this name exists, it is used. If it does not exist, it must be a top-level property.
member.remarks: May be null

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityPropertyMetadata.Programmable
member.summary:
True when this property should be exposed to custom programming.
Setting this to true or false does not guarantee that the application will respect this hint. This is NOT a security feature.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityPropertyMetadata.ExtensionUiProperty
member.summary:
True when this property might be used in an Extension UI and should be sent to a device presenting a UI that is backed by the property collection.
The application may choose to send all properties anyway. This is NOT a security feature.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityPropertyMetadata.ProgrammableValueRequiresRefresh
member.summary:
Driver authors should usually never set this.
Used to indicate properties where is true but properties will not change unless specifically refreshed.
This tells systems that they should not expect this value to asynchronously change to trigger things like automation unless they specifically refresh it. It is used when wrapping some existing class that does not provide a change event and should be avoided if possible.

member.remarks: This is a pure abstract class with an internal constructor. Think of it like an interface that other assemblies can consume but not implement.

member.name: M:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValue.#ctor(System.UInt64)
member.summary:
Casts the value to a and uses that value.
DO NOT USE. This only exists to avoid silently falling into the overload which can lead to unexpected and hard-to-debug errors. It is marked obsolete to help developers find inadvertent usages.
Use if possible, or, if you really need a value greater than 2^53, use to avoid losing precision when interacting with platforms that do not support 64-bit integers (like Javascript at the time of writing).
member.param: The associated value

member.name: T:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueRange
member.summary: Describes the possible range of values for a numeric property

member.name: M:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueRange.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Constructs an immutable range object

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueRange.Maximum
member.summary: The maximum value (inclusive), or null if no maximum applies

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueRange.Minimum
member.summary: The minimum value (inclusive), or null if no minimum applies

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueRange.StepSize
member.summary:
The smallest step size that applies to the value, like 1 for integers, or 0.5 or 0.01 for some other values. Will be null if no step size applies.
Note that this is the recommended minimum step size, and the actual step size may vary. The values between and may be spread in a non-linear fashion with more steps on one end than the other. Application should not assume they can calculate the real set-points of the device by adding multiples of the step size to the minimum value. Rather, this is more an indicator of the recommended precision of values to send to the driver.
When the units are known, applications may (and are encouraged to) have their own opinions on what the useful step size is and may skip some driver values or even apply a nonlinear scaling to what is presented to the user.
Drivers should expect to be given values that do not precisely line up with the advertised step size and should choose the closest valid value when this occurs.

member.name: T:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueRelativeRange
member.summary: Describes the properties of a "relative" range, typically over a 0.0 - 1.0 scale

member.name: M:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueRelativeRange.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Constructs an immutable relative range object

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueRelativeRange.StepSize
member.summary:
The smallest step size that applies to the range.
For example, this would be 0.01 for a percentage.
Note that this is the recommended minimum step size, and the actual step size may vary. The values may be spread in a non-linear fashion with more steps on one end than the other. Application should not assume they can calculate the real set-points of the device by using multiples of the step size. Rather, this is more an indicator of the recommended precision of values to send to the driver.
When the units are known, applications may (and are encouraged to) have their own opinions on what the useful step size is and may skip some driver values or even apply a nonlinear scaling to what is presented to the user.
Drivers should expect to be given values that do not precisely line up with the advertised step size and should choose the closest valid value when this occurs.

member.name: T:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueType
member.summary: Describes the type of a particular driver state value

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueType.Uninitialized
member.summary: Default uninitialized value

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueType.Boolean
member.summary: The value is

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueType.Number
member.summary: The value is a floating point value, represented by a

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueType.Integer
member.summary:
The value is an integer number, represented by a .
IMPORTANT NOTE: Some platforms (like Javascript) treat all numbers as and cannot represent integers greater than 2^53 without losing some precision. There is no provision in these data structures for , and drivers/applications are discouraged from using for any values that may exceed 2^53. Instead, if precise, large values are needed, should be used to avoid losing any precision.

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueType.String
member.summary: The value is .

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueType.Array
member.summary: The value is a homogenous collection of other states. The types of those instances must be specified in the .

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueType.Object
member.summary: The state is an object containing other states. If are defined, it can be thought of as a "class". Otherwise, the object is a dictionary where keys are strings and value types are specified by one of or , whichever of those two are set (they are mutually exclusive).

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueType.Entity
member.summary: The value is a ID that is for another entity with its own supported states, and commands. This is primarily used for sub-components of a device, like a PDU bank or the controls associated with a media endpoint.
member.remarks: This entity will NOT support configuration. The type describes an entity which may be configured.

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueType.Device
member.summary: The value is a ID that is for another device controller which is comprised of an entity and a configuration. This is primarily used for sub-devices like children on a platform device or a single compound device like a switch with four lights.

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueType.LocalizedString
member.summary: The value is but it is a localization key to be used with the translation dictionary.

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueType.NumericRange
member.summary: The value is a .

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueType.RelativeRange
member.summary: The value is a .

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueType.AvailableValue
member.summary: The value is a .

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityValueType.Any
member.summary:
The value is a generic whose type depends on run-time context
This is primarily used in generic commands like a "set value" command that might have different typed data for different values

member.name: T:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverControllerStatus
member.summary: Describes the life cycle of a driver controller running on the platform

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverControllerStatus.Unknown
member.summary: Default value when the status has not been set yet

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverControllerStatus.NotStarted
member.summary: Controller has not been started or is not running

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverControllerStatus.NotConfigured
member.summary: It is running, but not configured. Only configuration APIs are valid at this point.

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverControllerStatus.Running
member.summary: Controller is running and has been configured.

member.name: T:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityLocalizedString
member.summary: Represents a string that a driver may choose to localize using its translation dictionary.

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityLocalizedString.Text
member.summary:
The untranslated default text, typically in en-US language/culture. This is primarily intended for cases where the value is retrieved from the device at run-time and thus cannot be localized. Ideally, any labels known ahead of time would be localized.
Not all applications will support localization, so it is best practice for a driver developer to populate the label even when localization is in use.
Applications which support localization should prefer the localized value if available. If is null, the only option left is to use this value. Both may be null in cases where, if this were a single string, that would be null too.
May be null, although drivers should avoid using null here.

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityLocalizedString.LocalizationKey
member.summary:
The key that can be used to look up the localized value of this string in
May be null, even if other values in the driver are translated.

member.name: M:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Data.DriverEntityLocalizedString.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initialize with all required fields

member.summary: Type defined in this assembly which implements and has a default constructor.

member.name: M:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.DriverAssemblyEntryPointAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Initialize with required properties

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.DriverController.SupportedCultures
member.summary:
Retrieves all cultures supported by this device.
The format of the returned strings are "languagecode2-country/regioncode2" as defined by the ISO 639-1 standard and the ISO 3166 standard.
For example, "en-US" for English in the United States.

member.name: M:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.DriverController.GetLanguageTranslations(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves all the translated strings used by this device for the provided culture.
member.param:
Specifies the language code and country region code to be retrieved. The string must formatted as the "languagecode2" as defined by the ISO 639-1 standard, followed by a hyphen and then the "country/regioncode2" as defined by the ISO 3166 standard.
For example, "en-US" for English in the United States.
If the specified culture is not supported, this will return English, and if English is not supported then this will return the first language that is found in the driver. If there are no language translations then this will return null.

member.name: E:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.DriverController.SupportedCulturesChanged
member.summary: Raised when a supported culture is added or removed. See .

member.name: E:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.DriverController.LanguageTranslationsChanged
member.summary: Raised when any language translation is modified, added, or removed. See .

member.name: M:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.DriverController.TransportRx(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Handler for messages received from the device going to the driver
member.param: Id of the channel the data is coming in on (provided during configuration)
The content received from the device

member.name: T:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.DriverControllerCreationArgs
member.summary: Driver creation data. Applications MUST NOT modify this object after passing it to . Drivers MUST NOT modify this object at all Any public setters / mutable properties are there for convenience.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.DriverControllerCreationArgs.DriverId
member.summary:
Unique identifier assigned to this driver instance by the hosting application
This will not change across restarts of the hosting application and is intended to be used by the driver as an ID guaranteed to be unique across all other device drivers in the same system.
Some capabilities also involve relationships with other devices (i.e. driver instances) in the same family of devices. This ID is to be used in those capabilities in order for the hosting application to be able to refer to another device driver.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.DriverControllerCreationArgs.Logger
member.summary: Logger for the driver controller to use
member.remarks: This is required and must not be null

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.DriverControllerCreationArgs.DeviceModel
member.summary: The name of the device model that the user selected when adding this driver to the system. May be null or empty if no distinction was made and the driver must handle that "default" case.

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.DriverControllerCreationArgs.DriverDataDirectoryPath
member.summary: Path to the directory containing the driver and its data

member.name: P:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.DriverControllerCreationArgs.TransportTx
member.summary: Delegate for the driver to send data through hardware resources

member.name: T:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.DriverEntityEventArgs
member.summary: Describes an event notification from a device that is not a state change

member.name: T:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Logging.DriverControllerLogger
member.summary: Instance of a logger provided by the program to a driver which organizes its log messages on a per-controller basis.
member.remarks: This pure abstract class is designed to be consumed by drivers like an interface and should only be implemented by the hosting application. A class is used so that members may be added in a backwards-compatible way in the SDK with default implementations.

member.name: M:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Logging.DriverControllerLogger.IsEnabled(System.String,Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Logging.LogEntryLevel)
member.summary:
Checks if the current logging level will allow a log entry at the specified to be logged.
This method should be used to prevent unnecessary execution of logging code. For example, code that requires computations in the message arguments, passing of value types (because they will be boxed) or a loop that does nothing but log information.
member.param: Id of the controller that the log message originated from
Log entry level to check.
member.returns: True if the specified level will allow the entry to be logged.

member.name: M:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Logging.DriverControllerLogger.Exception(System.String,System.Exception,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Writes an exception to the hosting app/program's log.
It is recommended that calls made to this exception-logging-method are not guarded by checks of the current logging level so that any exceptions that occur are always logged.
member.param: Id of the controller that the log message originated from
The exception that occurred
Additional message format string to log along with the exception
Format args for

member.name: M:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Logging.DriverControllerLogger.GetCurrentLevel(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the current logging level
member.param: Id of the controller that the log message originated from
member.remarks: should be used to check if logging is enabled at a particular level.

member.name: M:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Logging.DriverControllerLogger.Log(System.String,Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Logging.LogEntryLevel,System.String)
member.summary: Writes a log entry/message to the hosting app/program's log
member.param: Id of the controller that the log message originated from
Log entry level associated with this message
The string to write to the log

member.name: M:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Logging.DriverControllerLogger.Log(System.String,Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Logging.LogEntryLevel,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes a log entry/message to the hosting app/program's log
member.param: Id of the controller that the log message originated from
Log entry level associated with this message

member.name: T:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Logging.LogEntryLevel
member.summary: Defines different logging levels.

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Logging.LogEntryLevel.Off
member.summary: Turns off all logging (including warnings and errors).

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Logging.LogEntryLevel.Trace
member.summary: Trace logging level is intended to output excessive debug messages, such as logging in a loop or every packet/message sent/received from a device.

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Logging.LogEntryLevel.Debug
member.summary: Debug logging level is intended to show the execution path of the code, without excessive verbosity (such as what is described in ).

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Logging.LogEntryLevel.Info
member.summary: Information logging level is for significant events that occurred, such as end-user actions, as well as any other information typically needed to identify what may have occurred. Technically, these are typically public methods being called or events being received from an external entity, such as device (as long as they are not too verbose).

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Logging.LogEntryLevel.Warning
member.summary: Warning logging level is for problems that occur, but the app/program can still function.

member.name: F:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.Logging.LogEntryLevel.Error
member.summary: Error logging level is for problems that may cause the app/program to no longer be functional. These may result in loss of functionality or may trigger recovery scenarios such as restarting processes/components or even a full restart of the app/program or a reboot of the device running that app/program.

member.name: T:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.StatusChangedEventArgs
member.summary: Describes a change in status for a particular controller

member.name: T:Crestron.DeviceDrivers.EntityModel.TransportTx
member.summary:
Delegate that a driver can use to access transport channels provided during configuration
These transport channels typically access some hardware resource like a com port or CEC port.
member.param: Id of the channel (provided by the application during configuration)
The data to send through the channel
